subject: Implement timeout for Notification Process
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2021-03-25 07:56:12.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor_server.py', 'tacker/conf/vnf_lcm.py', 'tacker/conductor/conductor_server.py'], 'message': 'Implement timeout for Notification Process

When sending notifications, the API is sent using requests.session.
Currently, no timeout value is set. Therefore, if there is no
response from the connected server, it will not be able to close
its own socket even if it terminates abnormally.

To resolve the problem, we add vnf_lcm.retry_timeout to tacker.conf.
When submitting the API, the timeout value is set to the requests
api. We set the default value to 10 seconds (with 3 tries).

Closes-Bug: #1911124
Change-Id: I63078635a8db5669dbd94ecf8c69bb3946ae0347
'}]
commit_message:
Implement timeout for Notification Process

When sending notifications, the API is sent using requests.session.
Currently, no timeout value is set. Therefore, if there is no
response from the connected server, it will not be able to close
its own socket even if it terminates abnormally.

To resolve the problem, we add vnf_lcm.retry_timeout to tacker.conf.
When submitting the API, the timeout value is set to the requests
api. We set the default value to 10 seconds (with 3 tries).

Closes-Bug: #1911124
Change-Id: I63078635a8db5669dbd94ecf8c69bb3946ae0347

commit_message:
Create action plugin to support artifact push

This action plugin has been created to support an artifact push during
deployment. This plugin will eventually be used to replace / enhance
the operator configuration and deployment experience by providing an
alternative to the existing pull model we're currently using. Now that
we're no longer requiring swift on the undercloud, there's no assumption
that an http server will be available within the confines of the
undercloud, while the existing pull interaction is still supported, the
push interaction should proved a better, more predictable, user
experience going forward.

Change-Id: I5d18cf334c1bc4011db968fbeb4f9e41869611cd
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support for Retry Operation

This feature will enable the client to use
this API to initiate retrying a VNF lifecycle
operation.

It is based on the ETSI NFV specification that
retry can be used when a VNF lifecycle operation
is in a FAILED_TEMP state.

Implements: blueprint support-error-handling
Spec: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tacker-specs/specs/wallaby/support-error-handling-based-on-ETSI-NFV.html
Change-Id: I96546338fba9946d8df3ffc7ab0003c5b44be85b

commit_message:
Fix wrong totalcount returned by share listing query

This bugfix [1] modified the totalcount returned by pagination
query when the argument 'limit' was specified. It caused
manila to do not return precise count of shares in a query that
satisfied the conditions.

This bug has been fixed and now manila is returning the precise
values of shares matched in a given query. Also, manila is now
performing filtering actions in the database to have more
performatic results.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688542/

Closes-Bug: #1860061

Co-Authored-By: Carlos Eduardo <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6ddd919bbd5180593cc52bf986912f65a2dab3a7

if rabbitmq is too much pressure or blockage.scheduler
will not received service capabilities, but once the
message queue(rabbitmq) returns to normal, scheduler

capabilities are acquired by manila share at different
times, so the timestamp of service capabilities shoud

scheduler layer(after rpc), once scheduler get an newer

Closes-Bug: #1908963
Change-Id: I6ce99ed4451c5d02cb4446861fa59e55a94951a5
'}]
commit_message:
scheduler should ignore earlier time service capabilities

if rabbitmq is too much pressure or blockage.scheduler
will not received service capabilities, but once the
message queue(rabbitmq) returns to normal, scheduler
will received many service capabilities, these service
capabilities are acquired by manila share at different
times, so the timestamp of service capabilities shoud
added at share manage layer(before rpc), but not
scheduler layer(after rpc), once scheduler get an newer
service capabilities, there is no need to update an
earlier service capabilities.

Closes-Bug: #1908963
Change-Id: I6ce99ed4451c5d02cb4446861fa59e55a94951a5

The default port number in swift has been changed from 600X to 620X,

commit_message:
Explicitly set port numbers used in swift storage

The default port number in swift has been changed from 600X to 620X,
so the actual port numbers should be explicitly set to make sure that
non-default values are used.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/725830/
Change-Id: I019ac55ddd3b5f9052953e8e75af0342141519ed

commit_message:
Add delete_on_termination for compute API v2.79 - os-volume_attachments

This adds delete_on_termination field for the compute API response schema
for the 2.79 microversion in the following APIs:

  - GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments (list)
  - GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments/{volume_id} (show)
  - POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments (attach)

Change-Id: I7a9b22477b800c6d60acb67c27aff5dcb61d7875

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-03-25 18:46:26.000000000', 'files': ['configuration.yaml'], 'message': 'Set up TC Vacancy Special Election

During the TC meeting today[*], an immediate special election was
authorized for filling the seat which was left vacant when the prior
election did not receive sufficient nominations to fill all
available seats. We will be holding an election for one remaining
seat in the 2021-Q1 to 2022-Q1 term. As discussed in the meeting
there will be two weeks for nominations (during which time
candidates can also campaign if desired), followed by one week of
voting if we have more than one candidate.

The election setup reflects the full 5 seats for the term, even
though four are already filled, and will display the four already
elected candidates for the term so that we can reuse the same
nominations directory. When the nominations period concludes, only
the candidates not already elected for the term will be added to a
new poll for a single seat.

[*] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/tc/2021/tc.2021-03-25-15.00.log.html#l-118

Change-Id: I2f78e3fa3474c1473b7805dc574a69e150e0bc6e
'}]
commit_message:
Set up TC Vacancy Special Election

During the TC meeting today[*], an immediate special election was
authorized for filling the seat which was left vacant when the prior
election did not receive sufficient nominations to fill all
available seats. We will be holding an election for one remaining
seat in the 2021-Q1 to 2022-Q1 term. As discussed in the meeting
there will be two weeks for nominations (during which time
candidates can also campaign if desired), followed by one week of
voting if we have more than one candidate.

The election setup reflects the full 5 seats for the term, even
though four are already filled, and will display the four already
elected candidates for the term so that we can reuse the same
nominations directory. When the nominations period concludes, only
the candidates not already elected for the term will be added to a
new poll for a single seat.

[*] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/tc/2021/tc.2021-03-25-15.00.log.html#l-118

Change-Id: I2f78e3fa3474c1473b7805dc574a69e150e0bc6e

commit_message:
Add ports filtering support to XtremIO Cinder driver

If there are some iSCSI or FC targets (ESXi for example) that
are not connected to the OpenStack host,
attach volume operation waits until timeout.
The XtremIO Cinder driver needs a new option to support ports
filtering.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/778982
Related-Bug: #1915800
Change-Id: I5d4934549de9350b8816d688ce8526dbc5d0f603
(cherry picked from commit cc8665d4738064e7e25466526d01c14903c6b505)

commit_message:
Move params from DocumentedRule to DeprecatedRule

Oslo policy moved "deprecated_*" parameters to the
DeprecatedRule object in [1] and deprecated it in
DocumentedRuleDefault object. Also bump oslo_policy
to the 3.7.0.

Similar change in neutron: https://review.opendev.org/781561
[1] https://review.opendev.org/766628

Change-Id: I14b215cdcd6458d67622360e4c910b3da1ae9848
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
base: print release version in case of running unsupported one

User may provide own base image but it needs to be supported one. If it
is not then we print info and error out.

So provide user with info which release is present in their image.

Change-Id: I0d8417fdeb2f02138d03cc57bd3b7b95bc43fc8f

commit_message:
Implement "kill" method using os.kill()

Implement the "kill" method (send a signal to a process) using the
Python native library "os".

In functional tests, "RootHelperProcess.kill" method should not fail if
the process does not exist.

Closes-Bug: #1843446
Closes-Bug: #1843418

Change-Id: Iee97a83779dd3e20eb3a223fb8557a94b8f15dc0

commit_message:
Call install_ingress_direct_goto_flows() when ovs restarts

When ovs restarts and needs to regenerate flows, some flows will be
missing in br-int, as follows:
 * table=60,priority=4,in_port="int-br-floating" actions=resubmit(,61)
 * table=60,priority=4,in_port="patch-tun" actions=resubmit(,61)
 * table=61,priority=0 actions=resubmit(,62)
Call install_ingress_direct_goto_flows() again in the
_handle_ovs_restart() to ensure generate these flows.

Change-Id: I240a78879db757592df138a53b2c22d7f5a9ae13
Closes-Bug: #1920700

subject: Allow HAProxy stats to be pinned to one or more processes
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-03-25 14:09:34.000000000', 'files': ['templates/haproxy.cfg.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow HAProxy stats to be pinned to one or more processes

When HAProxy is run in multi-process mode, the single stats page
shows metrics for one of the processes at a time, with a random
selection made on page reload.

Whilst a more complete solution may be to enable a stats page for
each process, this is a little cumbersome. This addition allows
the stats page to be pinned to one process, providing a partial
snapshot of the state of the instance.

Change-Id: Id9314e5b267aafeaf34c82874eb8bfe0713dfac3
'}]
commit_message:
Allow HAProxy stats to be pinned to one or more processes

When HAProxy is run in multi-process mode, the single stats page
shows metrics for one of the processes at a time, with a random
selection made on page reload.

Whilst a more complete solution may be to enable a stats page for
each process, this is a little cumbersome. This addition allows
the stats page to be pinned to one process, providing a partial
snapshot of the state of the instance.

Change-Id: Id9314e5b267aafeaf34c82874eb8bfe0713dfac3

commit_message:
Add artifact deployment option for push/pull model

This change introduces a new option to the upload-artifacts script which
will allow operators to both push and pull artifacts when deploying
them. This change will ensure operators are able to retain the ability
to pull artifacts from the undercloud or a remote source as needed,
while also defaulting to the new push mechanism.

Depends-On: I5d18cf334c1bc4011db968fbeb4f9e41869611cd
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib484959d77008b6a4455c01212d5c5b3a37738f7

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-03-18 05:19:44.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/upload-artifacts', 'releasenotes/notes/DeployArtifactURLs-Simplified-e3993493022653ab.yaml', 'scripts/upload-swift-artifacts', 'scripts/upload-puppet-modules'], 'message': "Update artifact tooling for swiftless underclouds

This change updates the artifact tooling to ensure that we're not

The tooling will now sync files locally and stand up an isolated
standalone http server when performing operations with the upload-*
scripts.

> upload tools have been updated to interact with systemd idle
  services to ensure we have isolated services, which provide
  the same user experience we've come to expect when running
  a deployment with artifacts.

All of the scripts maintain the existing API which will ensure
we're not breaking workflows, upgrades, or existing automation.

commit_message:
Update artifact tooling for swiftless underclouds

This change updates the artifact tooling to ensure that we're not
assuming we have access to a Swift deployment on the undercloud.
The tooling will now sync files locally and stand up an isolated
standalone http server when performing operations with the upload-*
scripts.

> upload tools have been updated to interact with systemd idle
  services to ensure we have isolated services, which provide
  the same user experience we've come to expect when running
  a deployment with artifacts.

All of the scripts maintain the existing API which will ensure
we're not breaking workflows, upgrades, or existing automation.

Change-Id: Ia6aed39781e8cb8184beccbfa1bf83f9926f5f37
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[NetApp] Implement security service update

This patch implements support for security service updates
for in use share networks. It works with all three security
service types. For 'active_directory' and 'kerberos', the 'domain'
attribute update isn't supported, since it can might affect
user's access to all related shares.

Change-Id: I8556e4e2e05deb9b116eacbd5afe2f7c5d77b44b
Depends-On: I129a794dfd2d179fa2b9a2fed050459d6f00b0de
Depends-On: I5fef50a17bc72ba66a3a9d6f786742bcb5745d7b
Implements: bp netapp-security-service-update
Co-Authored-By: Carlos Eduardo <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>

subject: PoC: CI: image build and test pipeline
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2021-03-02 09:56:26.000000000', 'files': ['tests/run.yml', 'tests/templates/globals-default.j2', 'zuul.d/base.yaml', 'zuul.d/project.yaml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'PoC: CI: image build and test pipeline

This change is a proof of concept that uses the opendev intermediate
registry to store Docker images built by a kolla-build-centos8-source
job, and later consumed by a kolla-ansible-centos8-source job.

The flow is similar to that described in
https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/base-jobs/latest/docker-image.html#a-repository-with-producers-and-consumers,
but with jobs in different repositories.

This patch is merely trying to get an idea of the moving parts involved
in this setup. It does not try to solve all cases.

One major concern with this approach is that the intermediate registry
exists only in one CI cloud provider, Rackspace. Each kolla build job
needs to upload many images to that registry, potentially from a
different cloud in a different region. This could result in a
significant amount of network traffic. Similarly, deploy jobs need to
pull images from the intermediate registry. This part may be mitigated
by publishing less frequently, and using a caching proxy in front of the
intermediate registry.

Change-Id: Ia1f483e75ffba81a6cd2c71f0d705673fd073bff
'}]
commit_message:
PoC: CI: image build and test pipeline

This change is a proof of concept that uses the opendev intermediate
registry to store Docker images built by a kolla-build-centos8-source
job, and later consumed by a kolla-ansible-centos8-source job.

The flow is similar to that described in
https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/base-jobs/latest/docker-image.html#a-repository-with-producers-and-consumers,
but with jobs in different repositories.

This patch is merely trying to get an idea of the moving parts involved
in this setup. It does not try to solve all cases.

One major concern with this approach is that the intermediate registry
exists only in one CI cloud provider, Rackspace. Each kolla build job
needs to upload many images to that registry, potentially from a
different cloud in a different region. This could result in a
significant amount of network traffic. Similarly, deploy jobs need to
pull images from the intermediate registry. This part may be mitigated
by publishing less frequently, and using a caching proxy in front of the
intermediate registry.

Change-Id: Ia1f483e75ffba81a6cd2c71f0d705673fd073bff

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-08-15 03:06:46.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: Iabf62907ac24c16857fa388acc048ba12267d4c1
Closes-Bug: #1693670
'}]
commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: Iabf62907ac24c16857fa388acc048ba12267d4c1
Closes-Bug: #1693670

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-25 17:21:25.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2fcb3599708586e11d8a24a628dee76d6de5fdd4
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I2fcb3599708586e11d8a24a628dee76d6de5fdd4

commit_message:
[NetApp] Implement cached status pool

In order to optimize the NetApp ONTAP driver, this patch is caching
the status of driver pools and reusing for the each share server,
given that the pool is not separated by share server.

The option `netapp_cached_aggregates_status_lifetime` is added
for controlling the time that the cached values is considered
valid.

Closes-Bug: #1900469
Change-Id: I14a059615fc29c7c173c035bb51d39e0bbb8b70a

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0 and update Sphinx requirement

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Cap to the previous version until
Bandit has fixed the problem.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start
capping it there as well.

NOTE(elod.illes): use upper-constraints.txt for docs tox target, to
limit dulwich to the version that was used in stable/pike. Also install
the content of requirements.txt otherwise those will be installed
unconstrained during the test run.

Conflicts:
    doc/requirements.txt

Change-Id: Ie6b379f2c99862c37891ac03c52464e07bc2b2cc
(cherry picked from commit 4f467fbd73092aadda8b42e517bb60a4782064ae)
(cherry picked from commit 012cdcd03a65da90d8aa36b2afc51e778957cc12)

commit_message:
Re-use transport for rpc calls

We are currently creating a new transport for each api
call. This patch changes that so that each worker
can re-use the same transport for multiple requests.

Story: 2008494
Task: 41544
Change-Id: I11a24f035a9d66a536e5e58328084ee08f0c6285
(cherry picked from commit 987c9d809eb393d5d644e4f85650d3d396d2319d)

commit_message:
rabbitmq: bump Erlang requirements to v23 in Debian

Current rabbitmq requires erlang v22.3+ while we had v22.1 on aarch64.

On x86-64 we use upstream repo so have both v22 and v23.

On AArch64 we use Linaro backports repo so have v23.2

Change-Id: I21c3a0e423235301269d0a5b212d0ce6970ab88f

subject: PoC: CI: image build and test pipeline
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2021-03-02 10:20:45.000000000', 'files': ['tests/playbooks/run.yml', '.zuul.d/debian.yaml', 'tests/playbooks/pre.yml', '.zuul.d/centos.yaml', '.zuul.d/base.yaml', '.zuul.d/project.yaml', '.zuul.d/ubuntu.yaml', 'docker/neutron/neutron-server/Dockerfile.j2', 'tests/playbooks/push.yml', 'kolla/common/config.py'], 'message': 'PoC: CI: image build and test pipeline

This change is a proof of concept that uses the opendev intermediate
registry to store Docker images built by a kolla-build-centos8-source
job, and later consumed by a kolla-ansible-centos8-source job.

The flow is similar to that described in
https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/base-jobs/latest/docker-image.html#a-repository-with-producers-and-consumers,
but with jobs in different repositories.

This patch is merely trying to get an idea of the moving parts involved
in this setup. It does not try to solve all cases.

One major concern with this approach is that the intermediate registry
exists only in one CI cloud provider, Rackspace. Each kolla build job
needs to upload many images to that registry, potentially from a
different cloud in a different region. This could result in a
significant amount of network traffic. Similarly, deploy jobs need to
pull images from the intermediate registry. This part may be mitigated
by publishing less frequently, and using a caching proxy in front of the
intermediate registry.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/777946

Change-Id: I3af289f85a8fb7f216719c893016b976d34da4d8
'}]
commit_message:
PoC: CI: image build and test pipeline

This change is a proof of concept that uses the opendev intermediate
registry to store Docker images built by a kolla-build-centos8-source
job, and later consumed by a kolla-ansible-centos8-source job.

The flow is similar to that described in
https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/base-jobs/latest/docker-image.html#a-repository-with-producers-and-consumers,
but with jobs in different repositories.

This patch is merely trying to get an idea of the moving parts involved
in this setup. It does not try to solve all cases.

One major concern with this approach is that the intermediate registry
exists only in one CI cloud provider, Rackspace. Each kolla build job
needs to upload many images to that registry, potentially from a
different cloud in a different region. This could result in a
significant amount of network traffic. Similarly, deploy jobs need to
pull images from the intermediate registry. This part may be mitigated
by publishing less frequently, and using a caching proxy in front of the
intermediate registry.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/777946

Change-Id: I3af289f85a8fb7f216719c893016b976d34da4d8

Fix FrozenError on Focal

This change ensures that a hash passed to a function is not directly
modified, to avoid FrozenError.

This patch adds a check prior to setting the send_periodic configuration

In case it is a provider network and the port is a gateway port,
send_periodic should be set to False to avoid leaking the RAs generated

Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Set send_periodic to False on provider networks

This patch adds a check prior to setting the send_periodic configuration
option for the LRP's ipv6_ra_configs to see if the network the LRP is
connected to is a provider network and the port is a gateway port.

In case it is a provider network and the port is a gateway port,
send_periodic should be set to False to avoid leaking the RAs generated
by ovn-controller to the tenant networks onto the provider network.

Closes-Bug: #1919347
Change-Id: I4e1ffb3a1eea147a750def245f869aca9e036b88
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

subject: Fix DevStack setup on CentOS 8.3
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'display_name': 'Radek', 'email': 'radek@piliszek.it', 'username': 'yoctozepto', 'status': 'self-employed techologist, collaborating mostly with 7bulls.com'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-09 17:27:47.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': 'Fix DevStack setup on CentOS 8.3

CentOS 8.3 changed the name of the PowerTools repository to powertools:
https://wiki.centos.org/Manuals/ReleaseNotes/CentOS8.2011#Yum_repo_file_and_repoid_changes

With this repository disabled, DevStack fails to install libyaml-devel,
which causes a failure to install many packages. In my environment
DevStack stopped with an error caused by a missing wget.

Keep the command using the old repository name, for compatibility with
older CentOS releases.

Change-Id: I5541a8aee8467abf10ce8a10d770618bdd693f02
(cherry picked from commit f361122798b9e3163790bee81abfa0486746fa8a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix DevStack setup on CentOS 8.3

CentOS 8.3 changed the name of the PowerTools repository to powertools:
https://wiki.centos.org/Manuals/ReleaseNotes/CentOS8.2011#Yum_repo_file_and_repoid_changes

With this repository disabled, DevStack fails to install libyaml-devel,
which causes a failure to install many packages. In my environment
DevStack stopped with an error caused by a missing wget.

Keep the command using the old repository name, for compatibility with
older CentOS releases.

Change-Id: I5541a8aee8467abf10ce8a10d770618bdd693f02
(cherry picked from commit f361122798b9e3163790bee81abfa0486746fa8a)

commit_message:
Fix DevStack setup on CentOS 8.3

CentOS 8.3 changed the name of the PowerTools repository to powertools:
https://wiki.centos.org/Manuals/ReleaseNotes/CentOS8.2011#Yum_repo_file_and_repoid_changes

With this repository disabled, DevStack fails to install libyaml-devel,
which causes a failure to install many packages. In my environment
DevStack stopped with an error caused by a missing wget.

Keep the command using the old repository name, for compatibility with
older CentOS releases.

Change-Id: I5541a8aee8467abf10ce8a10d770618bdd693f02
(cherry picked from commit f361122798b9e3163790bee81abfa0486746fa8a)

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-25 17:29:32.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0b3044df8f40db3ed5a3e7caf21d2749d13a5409
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I0b3044df8f40db3ed5a3e7caf21d2749d13a5409

commit_message:
Update master for stable/wallaby

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/wallaby.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/wallaby.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I06d375b708aeee5578acbf74ab323050df0b017b

commit_message:
Add create share from snapshot in CephFS

Remove capability_create_share_from_snapshot_support = False
from tempest config for both CephFS Native and CephFS NFS

Partially-Implements: blueprint create-share-from-snapshot-cephfs
Change-Id: Ifb984a3cee219fa97a9768495f80ff0c8349830b

subject: Allow Enable/Disable feature of uWSGI support
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-03-23 18:12:03.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Allow Enable/Disable feature of uWSGI support

Noticed uWSGI causing strange connection reset issue between senlin-api
and rabbitMQ, so adding support of variable to disable/enable uWSGI feature.

Change-Id: Idc41208fdf182e4ffd7b1b7d4940034697b60904

commit_message:
Allow Enable/Disable feature of uWSGI support

Noticed uWSGI causing strange connection reset issue between senlin-api
and rabbitMQ, so adding support of variable to disable/enable uWSGI feature.

Change-Id: Idc41208fdf182e4ffd7b1b7d4940034697b60904

commit_message:
Proposing Wallaby RC1 for kolla

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release,
someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch
with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

subject: Add helm.sh/hook related annotation for neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2021-03-18 03:04:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/templates/job-ks-service.yaml', 'neutron/templates/job-bootstrap.yaml', 'neutron/templates/job-ks-user.yaml', 'neutron/templates/job-rabbit-init.yaml', 'neutron/templates/job-db-init.yaml', 'neutron/templates/job-ks-endpoints.yaml', 'neutron/Chart.yaml', 'neutron/templates/job-db-sync.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/neutron.yaml', 'neutron/templates/job-image-repo-sync.yaml'], 'message': 'Add helm.sh/hook related annotation for neutron

Chart upgrading was failing due to some immutable fields in job are needed to upgrade. So, we thought using the post-install and post-upgrade
helm hook for job to force the job resource to execute after all resources are created. And as some jobs are dependent on each other i.e.
some jobs needs to run in order for helm hook to be successful. For that we used hook-weight to control resource creation order.

Change-Id: I26881324d101a986b7367d4682e9adcd07a24b13
'}]
commit_message:
Add helm.sh/hook related annotation for neutron

Chart upgrading was failing due to some immutable fields in job are needed to upgrade. So, we thought using the post-install and post-upgrade
helm hook for job to force the job resource to execute after all resources are created. And as some jobs are dependent on each other i.e.
some jobs needs to run in order for helm hook to be successful. For that we used hook-weight to control resource creation order.

Change-Id: I26881324d101a986b7367d4682e9adcd07a24b13

commit_message:
Use oslo.context from_dict unmodified

With the change to oslo.context in the depends-on, we no longer need
to maintain an override for the from_dict function.  We only need
to provide a list of additional keys in the appropriate class member.

NOTE(yoctozepto): This also improves the relevant testing.

Depends-On: Ib143f8a5c129dbf6711800c4d87c8830a8aa3365

Co-Authored-By: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If8e5839dee564f975804a2a661180e47c5107caf

commit_message:
Drop dep on python-masakariclient

There is no logic in python-masakariclient that masakari-dashboard
requires. It is safe to drop. The check for supported API versions
was irrelevant already as it depends directly on OpenStack SDK.

Change-Id: I97c6db49f1a4dbd36f7003299938a05994e37cb6

The timeout-client-data and timeout-member-data configurations
for Octavia listeners default to 50 seconds for load balancers
created by Kuryr. This patch allows the creation and modification
of load balancers handled by Kuryr with different timeouts values.

Implements: blueprint configure-lb-listeners-timeout
Change-Id: I99016001c2263023d1fa2637d7b5aeb23b3b2d9d
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to set listener timeouts for lb created by Kuryr

The timeout-client-data and timeout-member-data configurations
for Octavia listeners default to 50 seconds for load balancers
created by Kuryr. This patch allows the creation and modification
of load balancers handled by Kuryr with different timeouts values.

Implements: blueprint configure-lb-listeners-timeout
Change-Id: I99016001c2263023d1fa2637d7b5aeb23b3b2d9d

subject: Do not permit IPA standalone to be enabled by conf
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-03-25 11:45:54.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install/index.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/no-standalone-bb34eae2cc468837.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/config.py', 'ironic_python_agent/cmd/agent.py'], 'message': 'Do not permit IPA standalone to be enabled by conf

IPA standalone mode is a developer-only option, and if enabled
accidentally on a production agent could cause undesired behavior.

Developers who need this behavior should build a purpose-built agent,
with standalone hardcoded to True in cmd/agent.py.

Change-Id: Icc67dbe15acbbf6fee886f274d2169a0769a5053
'}]
commit_message:
Do not permit IPA standalone to be enabled by conf

IPA standalone mode is a developer-only option, and if enabled
accidentally on a production agent could cause undesired behavior.

Developers who need this behavior should build a purpose-built agent,
with standalone hardcoded to True in cmd/agent.py.

Change-Id: Icc67dbe15acbbf6fee886f274d2169a0769a5053

commit_message:

2. Remove multiattach support for flexgroup pools.

commit_message:
Follow up NetApp ONTAP FlexGroup feature

It is a follow up to the patch [1], providing the fixes:

1. Check the ONTAP storage version for the FlexGroup feature.
The feature is only accepted whether the ONTAP is 9.8 or greater.

2. Remove multiattach support for flexgroup pools.

3. Start bumping the driver version with its documentation.

4. Update the flexgroup release notes.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/776713

Change-Id: I0636b6530a79f8ca86db52f87273ec822c3cb406

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints

Per our PTG resolution [1] and general OpenStack resolution [2], lower-constraints
are not worth the extra work and confusion they introduce.
This patch drops them along with all mentions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-October/018445.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019521.html

Change-Id: I58807c27fd20c7269019e26e8b507744d35325f3
(cherry picked from commit 8e9323d236a26a6514cdc5a60ac220a50a81abc7)

commit_message:
Add Ghanshyam nomination as chair

I would like to nominate myself as chair of the
Technical Committee for Xena cycle.

I am serving as TC since Stein cycle, which is 3rd year. I am
trying my best to be more active in TC and leading the things
in various form, for example, community-wide goal, TC discussion
or any reach out to project teams. As TC chair, I would like to
continue the same and try to improve the TC interaction with
rest of the community.

Having my majority of the job time for upstream activities will help
me to fulfil all the TC chair duties[1] and to drive the new initiative
from TC or community.

Thanks for considering my nomination.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/governance/src/branch/master/CHAIR.rst

Change-Id: I856b360111339e25c50fbaed6b00a6c58472dc92

commit_message:
Remove extra/vif_port_id

Removes API translation layer into port/portgroup internal_info
Removes internal logic to support use of VIFs stored in the extra
field, which effectively means all vif binding must now utilize
vif attachment and detachment.

This is a change that we likely should have pushed forward a couple
years back, but I didn't want to break compatability with very old
of ironic or standalone users which were deploying instances using
very old instructions. That being said, it is necessary to remove
the legacy vif support so new access controls can properly wrap
vif API endpoints.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin/+/769204
Change-Id: I588b3a64475656542389ff83786189e2dc16d35c

subject: Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-24 05:38:06.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/secure-live-migration-with-qemu-native-tls.rst'], 'message': "Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of
the compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the
connection uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything
seems to work, but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the
live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6
(cherry picked from commit 5d5ff82bab1dfb12e6223446b1cf20db6a348f38)
(cherry picked from commit 276b8db5afd945bfc56ccfadd25bcce1b6df9cb7)
(cherry picked from commit a968289b1f89b52d7396b66294f768c732583849)
"}]
commit_message:
Add config parameter 'live_migration_scheme' to live migration with tls guide

This patch adds the config option 'live_migration_scheme = tls' to the
secure live migration guide.

To let the live migration use the qemu native tls, some configuration of
the compute nodes is needed. The guide describes this but misses the
'live_migration_scheme' config option.

It is necessary to set 'live_migration_scheme' to tls to use the
connection uri for encrypted traffic. Without this parameter everything
seems to work, but the unencrypted tcp-connection is still used for the
live migration.

Closes-Bug: #1919357
Change-Id: Ia5130d411706bf7e1c983156158011a3bc6d5cd6
(cherry picked from commit 5d5ff82bab1dfb12e6223446b1cf20db6a348f38)
(cherry picked from commit 276b8db5afd945bfc56ccfadd25bcce1b6df9cb7)
(cherry picked from commit a968289b1f89b52d7396b66294f768c732583849)

Proposing Wallaby RC1 for blazar

If you wants to wait for a specific patch to make it to the release,
someone from your team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that patch
with a different commit SHA.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday March 26.

commit_message:
Disable libvirtd.service before starting sockets

This change makes sure that libvirtd.service is stopped when starting
libvirtd-tcp/tls.socket, because these socket fails to start if
libvirtd.service is already running.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/759595/
Change-Id: I4a670aa77f0f0406a96db07877354b5067ddf1da
(cherry picked from commit 451f5203214ede6738cce5f2abeeae93a7f8ae36)
(cherry picked from commit 675474d0e55e1c7504ecfdcba65723aea4656142)
(cherry picked from commit 736a330cd2084fae4ac3199e5cf6b693f6fedd3a)

subject: Add neutron stable cores +2 powers in stable neutron-lib branches
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-25 14:14:27.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/neutron-lib.config'], 'message': "Add neutron stable cores +2 powers in stable neutron-lib branches

Core reviewers for neutron-lib stable branches were in
neutron-lib-stable-maint group. But this group i now empty and based on
current state of neutron and neutron-lib projects, I think that we can
replace that neutron-lib-stable-maint group with neutron-stable-maint
group so neutron stable cores will have same permissions in the
neutron-lib's stable branches as well.

Change-Id: Ied0b9820cdf86505380f2392a53ffeb130d0421f
"}]
commit_message:
Add neutron stable cores +2 powers in stable neutron-lib branches

Core reviewers for neutron-lib stable branches were in
neutron-lib-stable-maint group. But this group i now empty and based on
current state of neutron and neutron-lib projects, I think that we can
replace that neutron-lib-stable-maint group with neutron-stable-maint
group so neutron stable cores will have same permissions in the
neutron-lib's stable branches as well.

Change-Id: Ied0b9820cdf86505380f2392a53ffeb130d0421f

commit_message:
Added actions that enable clean removal of nova-compute unit from model

List of added actions:
* disable
* enable
* remove-from-cloud
* register-to-cloud

More detailed explanation of the process added to the README.md

Closes-Bug: #1691998
Change-Id: I45d1def2ca0b1289f6fcce06c5f8949ef2a4a69e

Make baremetal --debug actually work

The --debug option exists but does nothing. Wire in openstacksdk logging
and make sure ironicclient can log as well.

subject: Add a configurable URL base to staticweb
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-04 03:09:03.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/staticweb.py', 'etc/proxy-server.conf-sample', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_staticweb.py'], 'message': 'Add a configurable URL base to staticweb

This came to light because someone ran Tempest against a standard
installation of RDO, which helpfuly terminates SSL for Swift in
a pre-configured load-balancer. In such a case, staticweb has no
way to know what scheme to use and guesses wrong, causing Tempest
to fail.

Related upstream bug:
 https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1537071

Change-Id: Ie15cf2aff4f7e6bcf68b67ae733c77bb9353587a
Closes-Bug: 1572011
'}]
commit_message:
Add a configurable URL base to staticweb

This came to light because someone ran Tempest against a standard
installation of RDO, which helpfuly terminates SSL for Swift in
a pre-configured load-balancer. In such a case, staticweb has no
way to know what scheme to use and guesses wrong, causing Tempest
to fail.

Related upstream bug:
 https://bugs.launchpad.net/mos/+bug/1537071

Change-Id: Ie15cf2aff4f7e6bcf68b67ae733c77bb9353587a
Closes-Bug: 1572011

Ironic base puppet step config is ignored by API and conductor

'}]
commit_message:
Include missing Ironic puppet base step config

Ironic base puppet step config is ignored by API and conductor
services. Include it to apply the missed puppet configurations
for the base class.

Change-Id: I669c225b62ca40da579dcaf1c5213be2a3ed5923
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Change new policy rules for availability zones API

It was previously set that both SYSTEM and PROJECT READER could get
access to it. But this resource don't have project_id so PROJECT_READER
should be removed from that rule and only SYSTEM scope users should be
able to get it.

This patch also adds UT for policies for that API.

Related-blueprint: bp/secure-rbac-roles
Change-Id: Idfaf36c3dd003c9c5c1ce3f9ee889ba54643e831

The 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options are currently set by oslo configuration library.
However, in 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py' file these options cannot be

commit_message:
Set 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options in the 'libvirt' plugin to be defined in conf.d/libvirt.yaml

The 'libvirt_type' and 'libvirt_uri' options are currently set by oslo configuration library.
However, in 'monasca_agent/collector/virt/libvirt/inspector.py' file these options cannot be
provided by a configuration file. Changing this to retrieve both options from
'conf.d/libvirt.yaml' file.

Change-Id: I1918fda471e951f42db0d302e371108b664e936c
(cherry picked from commit 085f64578f40152273138898a0dc4566d327dc8f)

When the kolla version changes, such as adding new features or ceph
version upgrades, users need to upgrade the old version of the image
to the new version.
This commit provides a safer way to upgrade, serial mode, it has the
following features:

1. Only upgrade one ceph component on one node at a time.
2. Perform ceph status detection before upgrading each component,
upgrade only in HEALTH_OK state.
3.When upgrading osd, noout and norebalance are set before the upgrade
to prevent data rebalancing. The osd upgrade on the same node is also
run in sequence.

Please refer to the "Deploy ceph individually and upgrade securely"
section in the kolla-ansible documentation[0].

[0] kolla-ansible/doc/source/reference/ceph-guide.rst

Change-Id: Ia4cd15d64aef8d05d33b8a76c8d951d424dfe069

commit_message:
Support serial mode to upgrade ceph

When the kolla version changes, such as adding new features or ceph
version upgrades, users need to upgrade the old version of the image
to the new version.
This commit provides a safer way to upgrade, serial mode, it has the
following features:

1. Only upgrade one ceph component on one node at a time.
2. Perform ceph status detection before upgrading each component,
upgrade only in HEALTH_OK state.
3.When upgrading osd, noout and norebalance are set before the upgrade
to prevent data rebalancing. The osd upgrade on the same node is also
run in sequence.

Please refer to the "Deploy ceph individually and upgrade securely"
section in the kolla-ansible documentation[0].

[0] kolla-ansible/doc/source/reference/ceph-guide.rst

Change-Id: Ia4cd15d64aef8d05d33b8a76c8d951d424dfe069

commit_message:
docs: Add a real-time guide

This beefy patch closes a long-standing TODO and allows us to move yet
more information out of the flavors guide and into specific documents.
This, combined with existing documentation in place, means we can remove
the sections for various extra specs from the 'user/flavors' guide:

- hw:cpu_realtime            -> doc/source/admin/real-time.rst
- hw:cpu_realtime_mask       -> doc/source/admin/real-time.rst
- hw:emulator_threads_policy -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_policy              -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_thread_policy       -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_sockets             -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_cores               -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_threads             -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_max_sockets         -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_max_cores           -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:cpu_max_threads         -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:numa_nodes              -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:numa_cpus.N             -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:numa_mem.N              -> doc/source/admin/cpu-topologies.rst
- hw:mem_page_size           -> doc/source/admin/huge-pages.rst

Multiple improvements to the libvirt extra spec docs are included here,
for want of a better place to include them.

Change-Id: I02b044f8246f4a42481bb5f00259842692b29b71
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix ceph_mon check ceph cluster network

When deploying ceph_mon node, it will check cluster interface
and if there has no that interface,kolla-ansible will raise an
error, but this is not necessary for ceph itself.

Reslove by generating different configure task depends on different
ceph roles.

Change-Id: I64e5b3ee9136235070661685e72e4c6fa411cda4
Closes-Bug: #1729589

commit_message:
Use testenv deps instead of repeating the dependencies

The list of dependencies was incomplete in several tox environments.
Instead of replicating it, simply refer to the master testenv dependency
list.

Also use white space indenting consistently to be easier on the
eyes.

Change-Id: I80198d773d9cf9fdae72cfc649b533e1d14bb181

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I151e1cae71e4fd69db8e995e7464f109041a3990

revisions:

Increase RETRY_COUNT to 35 to provide sufficient time to complete

'}]
commit_message:
Update RETRY_COUNT for virtual media boot

Increase RETRY_COUNT to 35 to provide sufficient time to complete
already running iDRAC configuration job. This has been observed when
ironic performs boot mode synchronization, because the node boot mode
is not the same as bare-metal boot mode.

Story: 2008709
Task: 42043

Change-Id: I78c503a65c0c3fdb17773279d87db425926fa275

subject: Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-19 15:11:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/objects/quota.py'], 'message': "Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

The value fetched by Quotasv2_detail.get_resources() is ultimately
returned by Reservation.get_total_reservations_map. The total_reserved
value is returned by a sqlalchemy sum(), and is of a type defined by
the database driver in use. PyMySQL returns a Decimal here, which
the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer
value 0. This means that the value is an integer if zero, or a string
otherwise. This causes parsing difficulties for client libraries which
do strict type checking.

Testing note:
This method is already covered by the unit test
TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource, which also already
tests the return value and, implicitly, its type. However, it does not
currently fail because the unit tests run with SQLite rather than MySQL.
SQLite returns an int where MySQL returns a Decimal, which does not
trigger the bug.

TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource is sufficient to
demonstrate that the patch doesn't regress SQLite. We were not able to
think of a deterministic way to write a Tempest test for this, which
would cover MySQL. Ideally we would have the ability to run the DB test
suites under MySQL and PostreSQL in addition to SQLite using oslo.db's
OpportunisticDbFixture, but the scope of that is larger than this
change.

Closes-Bug: #1918565
Change-Id: Icda0d63f2f5ea72bde423296c76aa46646fa98a8
(cherry picked from commit 9ed17cec2d4ce0bd27e37c2877a413f5b302f4cd)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid JSON generated by quota details

The value fetched by Quotasv2_detail.get_resources() is ultimately
returned by Reservation.get_total_reservations_map. The total_reserved
value is returned by a sqlalchemy sum(), and is of a type defined by
the database driver in use. PyMySQL returns a Decimal here, which
the api layer serialises to JSON as a string.

Note that if a resource has no reservations then its value will be
defaulted in DbQuotaDriver.get_detailed_tenant_quotas to the integer
value 0. This means that the value is an integer if zero, or a string
otherwise. This causes parsing difficulties for client libraries which
do strict type checking.

Testing note:
This method is already covered by the unit test
TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource, which also already
tests the return value and, implicitly, its type. However, it does not
currently fail because the unit tests run with SQLite rather than MySQL.
SQLite returns an int where MySQL returns a Decimal, which does not
trigger the bug.

TestQuotaDbApi.test_get_reservations_for_resource is sufficient to
demonstrate that the patch doesn't regress SQLite. We were not able to
think of a deterministic way to write a Tempest test for this, which
would cover MySQL. Ideally we would have the ability to run the DB test
suites under MySQL and PostreSQL in addition to SQLite using oslo.db's
OpportunisticDbFixture, but the scope of that is larger than this
change.

Closes-Bug: #1918565
Change-Id: Icda0d63f2f5ea72bde423296c76aa46646fa98a8
(cherry picked from commit 9ed17cec2d4ce0bd27e37c2877a413f5b302f4cd)

subject: test integrate with docker-compose
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-02-01 09:03:29.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/memcached/tasks/config.yml', 'ansible/roles/memcached/handlers/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/memcached/tasks/pull.yml', 'tests/run.yml', 'ansible/roles/memcached/templates/memcached-compose.yml'], 'message': 'test integrate with docker-compose

There are serveral reason to do this.

- operators chould re-create the container very easily. just use
  docker-compose up or down
  
- all the container parameters are saved in the disk. operators could
  know waht is the exact parameters used.
  
- This also simplified the ansible logical.

Change-Id: I1f09b6702b26175011bf53acbcbae29c510889f5
'}]
commit_message:
test integrate with docker-compose

There are serveral reason to do this.

- operators chould re-create the container very easily. just use
  docker-compose up or down
  
- all the container parameters are saved in the disk. operators could
  know waht is the exact parameters used.
  
- This also simplified the ansible logical.

Change-Id: I1f09b6702b26175011bf53acbcbae29c510889f5

commit_message:
[WIP] Added playbooks for snap deployment

Snap is a telemetry-framework that can be used to collect
and publish metrics. This patch adds playbook for its deployment.
This patch also adds template of task manifest from which SNAP tasks are
created.

Change-Id: I32813dd353e96a02c826cfc541a1af4e8d7a91a4
Partially-implements: bp/monitoring
Co-Authored-By: Sayantani Goswami <sayantani.goswami@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2021-03-22 15:48:28.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Remove layout overrides and use tripleo-ci templates instead

As part of [1] and in line with all other tripleo repos lets use
the tripleo-ci templates. The files: and irrelevant-files matches
are moved to tripleo-ci in the depends-on. This leaves only the
undercloud-minion job in the overrides as it isn't covered by the
templates, but updates tags.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/781322

Change-Id: Id8bdcc314f68fb35050254c6c64fd2317c2555de
"}]
commit_message:
Remove layout overrides and use tripleo-ci templates instead

As part of [1] and in line with all other tripleo repos lets use
the tripleo-ci templates. The files: and irrelevant-files matches
are moved to tripleo-ci in the depends-on. This leaves only the
undercloud-minion job in the overrides as it isn't covered by the
templates, but updates tags.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:tripleo-ci-reduce

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/781322

Change-Id: Id8bdcc314f68fb35050254c6c64fd2317c2555de

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6a30ef8373ba30cbc9c9d0d6de1d640dc349d967

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie501d9e209309990a0ec4d7a4be6f306277cb2b4

subject: Fix condition when to create backends
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-25 07:59:54.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'vars/main.yml'], 'message': 'Fix condition when to create backends

Backend creation should happen on the last host in the group, instead
of the first one, since we put LB in MAINT state during deployment, while
other containers are not ready yet. Thus we should be creating backends
at the very end of the deployment, when all containers are set.

Change-Id: I3d5811e059d1b5cb3e87fe7657872e41105c832e
Closes-Bug: #1920964
'}]
commit_message:
Fix condition when to create backends

Backend creation should happen on the last host in the group, instead
of the first one, since we put LB in MAINT state during deployment, while
other containers are not ready yet. Thus we should be creating backends
at the very end of the deployment, when all containers are set.

Change-Id: I3d5811e059d1b5cb3e87fe7657872e41105c832e
Closes-Bug: #1920964

subject: Retry on creating trove network
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2021-03-24 18:18:29.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/trove_service_network.yml'], 'message': 'Retry on creating trove network

For pretty weird reason, first request to create a network to the neutron
fails with 500 without reasonable stack trace. Re-running request succeeds.
So we adding retries to the task which resolves metnioned issue.

Change-Id: I5b09dc3bc52d98df756cdc60c5e94cd1e7344e9a
'}]
commit_message:
Retry on creating trove network

For pretty weird reason, first request to create a network to the neutron
fails with 500 without reasonable stack trace. Re-running request succeeds.
So we adding retries to the task which resolves metnioned issue.

Change-Id: I5b09dc3bc52d98df756cdc60c5e94cd1e7344e9a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-23 14:49:13.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/storlets-functional/run.yaml'], 'message': 'Use Python3 in client side to run Python2 functional tests

This change makes Python2 functional tests use Python 3 client side
to avoid "InterpreterNotFound: python2.7" error with tox in focal.
Server side processes are still launched on Python 2.7.

Change-Id: Ie2ac2b6c05d54e5a7798447ce7c120c2422140e4
'}]
commit_message:
Use Python3 in client side to run Python2 functional tests

This change makes Python2 functional tests use Python 3 client side
to avoid "InterpreterNotFound: python2.7" error with tox in focal.
Server side processes are still launched on Python 2.7.

Change-Id: Ie2ac2b6c05d54e5a7798447ce7c120c2422140e4

subject: Add warning log when restarting docker container
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-01-30 06:46:32.000000000', 'files': ['storlets/gateway/gateways/docker/runtime.py'], 'message': 'Add warning log when restarting docker container

When a storlet application or its dependencies are updated, we first
try restarting storlet daemon, but if it fails then we restart the
whole container, which might cause ungraceful shutdown of the other
storlet daemon in the same container.

This change adds a warning log so that operators can understand how
many times such stop failure have happened in the deployment.

Change-Id: I2843bf1118505a2e32e1f80e7329ed73de1cd62d
'}]
commit_message:
Add warning log when restarting docker container

When a storlet application or its dependencies are updated, we first
try restarting storlet daemon, but if it fails then we restart the
whole container, which might cause ungraceful shutdown of the other
storlet daemon in the same container.

This change adds a warning log so that operators can understand how
many times such stop failure have happened in the deployment.

Change-Id: I2843bf1118505a2e32e1f80e7329ed73de1cd62d

commit_message:
Nova kubernetes changes

* Changed interface to listen to 0.0.0.0
* Allows the user to point at a cluster for the following services that
  isn't defined by the Ansible hostvars:
	* RabbitMQ
	* MemcacheD
	* Neutron
	* Keystone

Change-Id: Iadbdd3aa43f9ba91ec820220fb8828e69161c579
Co-authored-by: Ryan Hallisey <rhallise@redhat.com>
Partially-implements: blueprint api-interface-bind-address-override

subject: Horizon Frontend - (for kolla-kubernetes)
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-25 01:53:10.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/horizon-frontend/meta/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/haproxy.cfg.j2', 'ansible/roles/horizon-frontend/tasks/config.yml', 'ansible/roles/horizon-frontend/templates/haproxy.cfg.j2', 'ansible/roles/horizon-frontend/templates/haproxy.json.j2', 'ansible/roles/haproxy/templates/haproxy-base.cfg.j2', 'ansible/roles/horizon-frontend/defaults/main.yml', 'ansible/roles/horizon-frontend/tasks/main.yml', 'docker/base/Dockerfile.j2', 'ansible/site.yml', 'ansible/inventory/all-in-one'], 'message': 'Horizon Frontend - (for kolla-kubernetes)

Horizon is a web application that is distributed between the web
server, and the web browser. If the web server is upgraded while
the application is still running on the web browser, unusual issues
can creep up.

This patch allows for an haproxy based frontend container to be
created that, through kolla config options, allows multiple horizon
backends to be defined, browsers to be temporarily bound to the
versions they initially landed on, and new horizons introduced for
testing and promotion to default.

Two new variables are defined:
 * horizon_versions: an array of versions that are part of the
   system. Defaults to ["1"]
 * horizon_version_default: new browser sessions coming in are
   defaulted to this version. Defaults to "1"

So, for example, with the following config, older existing sessions
will continue to work on version 1 (say, Mitaka based), and all new
connections will go to version 2 (say, Newton based), allowing
version 1 to be gracefully drained and eventually deleted:
  horizon_versions: ["1", "2"]
  horizon_version_default: "2"

It is intended to be used along with corresponding logic in Kolla-Kubernetes.

Change-Id: I2dcd0fc224a959cc36cb7fd2a2adc99be280b7ff
'}]
commit_message:
Horizon Frontend - (for kolla-kubernetes)

Horizon is a web application that is distributed between the web
server, and the web browser. If the web server is upgraded while
the application is still running on the web browser, unusual issues
can creep up.

This patch allows for an haproxy based frontend container to be
created that, through kolla config options, allows multiple horizon
backends to be defined, browsers to be temporarily bound to the
versions they initially landed on, and new horizons introduced for
testing and promotion to default.

Two new variables are defined:
 * horizon_versions: an array of versions that are part of the
   system. Defaults to ["1"]
 * horizon_version_default: new browser sessions coming in are
   defaulted to this version. Defaults to "1"

So, for example, with the following config, older existing sessions
will continue to work on version 1 (say, Mitaka based), and all new
connections will go to version 2 (say, Newton based), allowing
version 1 to be gracefully drained and eventually deleted:
  horizon_versions: ["1", "2"]
  horizon_version_default: "2"

It is intended to be used along with corresponding logic in Kolla-Kubernetes.

Change-Id: I2dcd0fc224a959cc36cb7fd2a2adc99be280b7ff

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-09 22:24:09.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/site.yml', 'ansible/strategy_plugins/extensible.py'], 'message': 'DO NOT MERGE!: PoC of ansible override

We can't merge this until we deal with license issues. This strategy
plugin will allow to include custom tasks into ansible playbook without
changing kolla code.

To include file after any task with Aodh in name, put this into
globals.yml

ansible_override:
    include_after:
        task: "Aodh"
        file: "/home/ubuntu/test.yml"

Change-Id: If5f6a6479ebf5b94a2a55dc40d55c2e00f20a5e4
'}]
commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE!: PoC of ansible override

We can't merge this until we deal with license issues. This strategy
plugin will allow to include custom tasks into ansible playbook without
changing kolla code.

To include file after any task with Aodh in name, put this into
globals.yml

ansible_override:
    include_after:
        task: "Aodh"
        file: "/home/ubuntu/test.yml"

Change-Id: If5f6a6479ebf5b94a2a55dc40d55c2e00f20a5e4

commit_message:
New test, extends test_subport_connectivity

Related-Bug: #1869244

Adding new test, test_subport_connectivity_soft_reboot
The test is checking trunks and ports are recreated during server
reboots, especialy in ovs_dpdk ports,
Since test flow is variant of test_subport_connectivity
Two methods added and used in the tests:
_create_servers_with_trunk_port
_check_servers_remote_connectivity

Change-Id: Ia5fbe680bb904680f52e0e15056d629717a643af

commit_message:
Fix Docker registry port error in image-building.rst

The default port of Docker registry is 5000. But the 5000 port is also
the port of keystone-api. To avoid conflict, use 4000 port as Docker
registry port.

Change-Id: I3885cdbb3d4e68db2d34e479b2e974286036fdd7

commit_message:
Add UEFI deploy file in ironic pxe container

Currently, ironic which deployed by kolla-ansible just support pxe
method to deploy OS, add support for UEFI deploy.

The UEFI support guide is in "PXE UEFI setup" section:
https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/install/configure-pxe.html

Change-Id: I52c4c3a2088b024d2173260910efc93a4ec4b06c

commit_message:
Kube OVS DB to listen on tcp:port and neutron-ovs-agent to use script

This PS adds tcp socket to ovsdb process to listen to and it also changes
neutron-openvswitch-agent start command. It will start via script which  now
accepts orchestration specific parameters.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I0c5e51fbce7776ba38eb1cca4b040017b0d69351

commit_message:
Add external ceph support for cinder and glance

Modify the conditional strategy for cinder and glance regarding ceph:
use cinder_volume_driver and glance_volume_driver instead of
enable_ceph.

Introduced some config values into globals.yml and passwords.yml to be
able to use the ceph driver without deploying a ceph cluster.

This strategy could be used in other versions.

WARNING: before merging into "stable", please test the non-regression
in the "enable_ceph=yes" situation (deploying a ceph cluster). It
should be compatible but has not been tested.

Co-Authored-By: Mathias Ewald <mewald@evoila.de>
Change-Id: If05eefcf1c91e4d564ec32d12d144f47564162d6
Implements: spec external-ceph
Signed-off-by: Sebastien Fuchs <sebastien@emmene-moi.fr>

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2018-08-03 07:51:00.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kolla-ceph-bluestore.rst', 'docker/ceph/ceph-osd/extend_start.sh', 'docker/kolla-toolbox/find_disks.py'], 'message': 'Optimize bluestore deployment in kolla

The following optimizations were made to the bluestore deployment:

1. Change osd partition-related naming rules to easily obtain relevant
disk information
2. In find_disks.py, separate the disk information of ceph and other
components, and optimize disk results for filestore and bluestore,
discard disk information that is not relevant.
3. Direct use of disk partition variables, no additional judgment is
required to determine the disk type.
4. Supports three combinations of partition labels to initialize osd.
5. Solved the problem of block partition computing weight error.
6. Modify the type id of the osd partition to avoid container startup
failure caused by ceph automount.

Change-Id: Ic2cd282eb81368b7361a8012544e0b240102e3f5
Closes-bug: #1776888

commit_message:
Optimize bluestore deployment in kolla

The following optimizations were made to the bluestore deployment:

1. Change osd partition-related naming rules to easily obtain relevant
disk information
2. In find_disks.py, separate the disk information of ceph and other
components, and optimize disk results for filestore and bluestore,
discard disk information that is not relevant.
3. Direct use of disk partition variables, no additional judgment is
required to determine the disk type.
4. Supports three combinations of partition labels to initialize osd.
5. Solved the problem of block partition computing weight error.
6. Modify the type id of the osd partition to avoid container startup
failure caused by ceph automount.

Change-Id: Ic2cd282eb81368b7361a8012544e0b240102e3f5
Closes-bug: #1776888

subject: Support multipath disk for bluestore in kolla
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7488, 'name': 'Jeffrey Zhang', 'email': 'zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com', 'username': 'Jeffrey4l'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23717, 'name': 'Surya Prakash Singh', 'email': 'singh.surya64mnnit@gmail.com', 'username': 'SuryaPrakash'}, {'_account_id': 24250, 'name': 'wangwei', 'email': 'wangw88916@126.com', 'username': 'Dream_x'}, {'_account_id': 24574, 'name': 'Tone Zhang', 'email': 'tone.zhang@arm.com', 'username': 'tone.zhang'}, {'_account_id': 28743, 'name': 'huang liujie', 'email': 'huang.liujie@99cloud.net', 'username': 'ljhuang'}, {'_account_id': 30356, 'name': 'gugug', 'email': 'gu.jin@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gujin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2019-07-11 07:00:14.000000000', 'files': ['docker/ceph/ceph-osd/extend_start.sh', 'docker/kolla-toolbox/find_disks.py'], 'message': "Support multipath disk for bluestore in kolla

1. Support for bluestore osd deployment on multipath disks.
2. Because the symbolic link of the multipath disk uses the format
of 'typecode.partuuid', in order to maintain consistency, the symbolic
link of the regular disk changes from partlabel to partuuid.
3. There are many types of disk naming suffixes that are 'p+number',
such as the default naming of multipath disks, bcache disks, but the
script currently only supports loop devices, this patch fixes this
problem.
4. Optimized the return information of find_disks.py, only returns
valid disk information, does not return null values.
5. Kolla supports calculating the weight of osd according to the size
of the disk. The current script uses the osd data partition(100M) when
calculating the weight of the bluestore osd. The block partition
should be used. This patch fixes this problem.

Closes-bug: #1741489

Change-Id: I5b544a966edf5f0814cc14fd964d04c4687045e1
"}]
commit_message:
Support multipath disk for bluestore in kolla

1. Support for bluestore osd deployment on multipath disks.
2. Because the symbolic link of the multipath disk uses the format
of 'typecode.partuuid', in order to maintain consistency, the symbolic
link of the regular disk changes from partlabel to partuuid.
3. There are many types of disk naming suffixes that are 'p+number',
such as the default naming of multipath disks, bcache disks, but the
script currently only supports loop devices, this patch fixes this
problem.
4. Optimized the return information of find_disks.py, only returns
valid disk information, does not return null values.
5. Kolla supports calculating the weight of osd according to the size
of the disk. The current script uses the osd data partition(100M) when
calculating the weight of the bluestore osd. The block partition
should be used. This patch fixes this problem.

Closes-bug: #1741489

Change-Id: I5b544a966edf5f0814cc14fd964d04c4687045e1

commit_message:
Corrects missing packages from Xen

Two additional packages are necessary for xen to properly install
on the compute nodes. These packages are python2 and needed only
in the centos binary deployments. Xen is only compatible with that
version of openstack.

Change-Id: Id6ddb5688184b18e6fab11f3252a9083bffda5aa
Closes-bug: #1837767

commit_message:
Upgrade Haproxy to version 1.8.x

Haproxy in centos 7 repos version is only 1.5.18 [1].
It's quite outdated. Kolla should upgrade Haproxy
package to 1.8.x version for new features.

Use centos software collections repo. Haproxy
version up to 1.8.17. [2]

[1] http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/os/x86_64/Packages/haproxy-1.5.18-8.el7.x86_64.rpm
[2] https://www.softwarecollections.org/en/scls/rhscl/rh-haproxy18/

Change-Id: Iaba10969c8bdea80b690848a9aa2f955e47c8b1a

commit_message:
split templates to work around configparser bug

Move the percent character to the template from the string to allow
setting either % or %% as needed to work around the bug linked below.
This requires each service 'family' to have two versions of it's config
file.

Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1872553

Change-Id: I68f276224c51d5682d77123eae697767fadf9b19
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>
(cherry picked from commit 3e151d97adbff78be1b146938374a0dced5970e9)

Publish weekly

To better utilise caches during the working week, we decided
to publish only weekly (as opposed to daily).
This is due to DockerHub-imposed limits.

commit_message:
Adding support of subnet_dns_publish_fixed_ip extension in ml2 plugin

The subnet-dns-publish-fixed-ip extension adds a new attribute to the definition of the subnet resource. When set to true it will allow publishing DNS records for fixed IPs from that subnet independent of the restrictions described in the [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/admin/config-dns-int-ext-serv.html

Change-Id: I095564cec0f5804e4d0ea9b5201ed40b9d9be603

subject: Extend timeout for RPM verification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-25 07:47:46.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/rhel7stig/zypper.yml', 'tasks/rhel7stig/rpm.yml', 'tasks/rhel7stig/async_tasks.yml'], 'message': 'Extend timeout for RPM verification

For systems with many packages deployed or heavy loaded environments
rpm verification takes the way more time then 5 minutes ending up in
corrupted database of the rpm packages. So we set limit to 1 hour
and extending amount of retries to wait for result to match the async
timeout

Change-Id: I30d29630214914bea99fc7fd66afa3218705d733
Closes-Bug: #1921292
'}]
commit_message:
Extend timeout for RPM verification

For systems with many packages deployed or heavy loaded environments
rpm verification takes the way more time then 5 minutes ending up in
corrupted database of the rpm packages. So we set limit to 1 hour
and extending amount of retries to wait for result to match the async
timeout

Change-Id: I30d29630214914bea99fc7fd66afa3218705d733
Closes-Bug: #1921292

This commit makes the delete_router_port() method from OVNClient more
resilient to NotFound errors. Apart from the L3 plugin, this method is
also invoked by the maintenance task to fix stale/not-up-to-date objects
in the OVN database, and since the maintenance task runs every 5 minutes
only it could happen that some objects fetched by delete_router_port()
are gone by the moment that method is invoked.

Change-Id: I0d78278797beb2af42ec38462e2b2edc8e2a4ae6
Closes-Bug: #1920968
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Make delete_router_port() less error prone

This commit makes the delete_router_port() method from OVNClient more
resilient to NotFound errors. Apart from the L3 plugin, this method is
also invoked by the maintenance task to fix stale/not-up-to-date objects
in the OVN database, and since the maintenance task runs every 5 minutes
only it could happen that some objects fetched by delete_router_port()
are gone by the moment that method is invoked.

Change-Id: I0d78278797beb2af42ec38462e2b2edc8e2a4ae6
Closes-Bug: #1920968
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
DNM: Rename 'instance_type' parameter

Instance types are dead. Long live flavors.

There are *loads* more references to 'instance_type' here. We don't
touch a single one of these. Those will be done in a follow-up like
change I264d6df1809d7283415e69a66a9153829b8df537.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Process subordinate releases packages map

For principal - subordinate plugin type relations where the
principal Python payload imports code from packages managed by a
subordinate, upgrades can be problematic.

This change will allow a subordinate charm that have opted into the
feature to inform its principal about all implemented release -
packages combinations ahead of time. With this information in place
the principal can do the upgrade in one operation without risk of
charm relation RPC type processing at a critical moment.

Also sync c-h.

Closes-Bug: #1806111
Change-Id: I95567d5d047eb64842436e671b74a633e6f509f4

subject: Bump the Compute RPC API to version 6.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-25 09:56:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_numa_live_migration.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/objects/service.py', 'nova/tests/functional/integrated_helpers.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_compute_mgr.py'], 'message': "Bump the Compute RPC API to version 6.0

Even if we want to bump the compute rpc api to a new major version, we still
need to support 5.x for the rolling upgrade case.

Adding a proxy that will handle those old RPC calls/casts so we could easily
cut it in a later change in the next X release timeframe (as we won't longer
support Victoria 5.x calls)

On the client side, we're making sure that we can still support v5.x methods
until the next X release (as operators could pin on 5.0 version for Victoria
compute nodes)

NOTE(sbauza): Now that the compute service only supports the 6.0
version, we could remove all the unnecessary verifications in both the
manager but also the functional and unittests. That being said, given
the patch would be large, I think it's better to just amend the needed
modifications for supporting 6.0 and delete the above in later changes.
For example, the NUMA live migration functests verify a lot of RPC API
compatibilities in between 5.2, 5.3 and later. We need to stop verifying
this but let's do this in later changes, please.

Change-Id: I4529b4b36b390935ac0227d94db398d65ae11ce0
"}]
commit_message:
Bump the Compute RPC API to version 6.0

Even if we want to bump the compute rpc api to a new major version, we still
need to support 5.x for the rolling upgrade case.

Adding a proxy that will handle those old RPC calls/casts so we could easily
cut it in a later change in the next X release timeframe (as we won't longer
support Victoria 5.x calls)

On the client side, we're making sure that we can still support v5.x methods
until the next X release (as operators could pin on 5.0 version for Victoria
compute nodes)

NOTE(sbauza): Now that the compute service only supports the 6.0
version, we could remove all the unnecessary verifications in both the
manager but also the functional and unittests. That being said, given
the patch would be large, I think it's better to just amend the needed
modifications for supporting 6.0 and delete the above in later changes.
For example, the NUMA live migration functests verify a lot of RPC API
compatibilities in between 5.2, 5.3 and later. We need to stop verifying
this but let's do this in later changes, please.

Change-Id: I4529b4b36b390935ac0227d94db398d65ae11ce0

commit_message:
split templates to work around configparser bug

Move the percent character to the template from the string to allow
setting either % or %% as needed to work around the bug linked below.
This requires each service 'family' to have two versions of it's config
file.

Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1872553

Change-Id: I68f276224c51d5682d77123eae697767fadf9b19
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
Set default OVS_SYSCONFDIR value depending on OVS_PREFIX

When OVN is built from source, the value of OVS_PREFIX is set to
"/usr/local". All other paths referring to OVS should be prefixed
with this value.

Closes-Bug: #1920634
Related-Bug: #1918656

Change-Id: I9a45a5379d1c47cdf67b9c6d3d0409a88501e61e
